New Records: Phil Salt scored 88 runs off 59 balls in an eight-wicket win over West Indies
Key Match Events: England beat West Indies by eight wickets with 15 balls to spare
Phil Salt reached a half-century from 38 deliveries
Jonny Bairstow went big, slamming Joseph's first two balls for six and four
Moeen Ali was caught on the boundary for 13 off the bowling of Andre Russell
West Indies set England a 181-run target
Powell dances down the pitch and fries Livingstone for six, six more follows and then the dog turns round, sits on the remote and changes the channel to American idol
Powell swivels for a cross-court forehand up and away for six
Pooran sweeps a full-toss for four
Pre-Game Insights: Jos Buttler calls correctly on what looks like a steamy St Lucia night
Rovman Powell says he'd have bowled too but 'it looks a very good pitch'
Post-Match Reflections: Rovman Powell: 'I think we left 15-20 runs out there as a batting group but we could give a better display as a bowling group too'
Jos Buttler: 'I thought it was a really good performance from us, we executed really well with the bat and ball'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The crowd is building and everything feels ripe for a belter and who knows, maybe the first centurion of the tournament
The wind is whistling in and Mark Wood powers in over his shoulder
The steel band panning out hits from David Rudder and Nadia Batson outside the stadium, and then pulsing party soca - Shazam fodder territory for the names - being blared out inside
